text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

As you can tell, uh, I got so many requests
to do something Rubik’s Cube,

and I was going to make a Rubik’s Cube Cake,
but, I got invited to a party tonight
and they wanted brownies.

So I got to thinking and I thought, why not
make Rubik’s Cube Brownie Bites!

These are gonna be super-easy mode, they are
a beginner level easy mode.

All you’re gonna need to do is bake a sheet
of brownies, I am in a hurry though, so

I went to the grocery store, and I actually
found these pre-made, they’re brownie bites.

And they come in little cubes. And, if you
have time, bake a batch of brownies,

and then cut them into squares, put them in
the freezer for about 30 minutes,

and then when you pop them out you’ll have
little brownie cubes.

And that is what we want, brownie cubes, just
bite sized little yummies.

Oh my gosh, look at this, this is too perfect,
I even found a Rubik’s cube necklace,

I was shopping at a local store, I’ll put
a link down below, it even spins around,

look, oh, oh! I can spin it, look it! Eeee-dee-dee!
Look at that it spins.
Alright, alright, enough with that!
Alright, let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: cubed brownie
bites, I have ganache frosting, but

you can use your favorite chocolate frosting,
I have a piece of wax paper,

baking scissors and this squared template,
I’ll put a link down below, so if you’re

interested in using the same template I did
you can. I just have a piece of

cardboard paper to put this on top of, scotch
tape, and 6 different colors of chocolate melts

for all the Rubik’s cube colors, we have
orange, yellow, red, green, blue and white.
Alright, let’s put it all together!

The 1st thing that you’re gonna do is pick
out 27 of your little brownie bite cubes,

I tried to pick out the ones that were the
most square, and now we’re just gonna

stack them and attach them with our ganache
frosting.

You’re gonna pick up a cube and you’re
gonna put a little frosting on ‘em to connect ’em.

And then you’re just gonna stick ‘em together
like this.
Bewp!
This is so fun, this is like building blocks.

Once you’ve got your brownies all stacked
together, look at that, they look just like

a little Rubik’s Cube! I’m gonna put this
in the freezer for about 5 minutes,

and while that’s in there, I am gonna melt
some chocolates.
And make all my little Rubik’s cube colors.

I’ve just taped down our square template
and then I’m gonna put this piece of wax paper
on top, now I’m gonna fill in some squares.

I’m just eyeballing it, it doesn’t have
to be perfect.

And then you’re gonna do that with all of
your other colors.
Time to melt more chocolate.

Alright, last step, we’ve got our brownie
Rubik’s Cube and we got all the cube colors,

and I’ve got that chocolate ganache, and now
what we’re gonna do is pick up a little

chocolate color, put a little ganache on the
back and place them on every single bite,

just cover your whole cube of brownies, chocolate
on chocolate, yum, yum, yum, yum!
Ta-da!
Rubik’s Cube Bite Sized Brownies!

These things are awesome, thanks for suggesting
something Rubik’s Cube, they’re perfect

for parties, you can just take a toothpick,
poke it into a little brownie, owmp!

Bite size! So many to share with friends,
this is awesome!

If you have any other suggestions for any
other Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!

Also you can follow me on Facebook, Twitter,
Tumblr, Instagram, I will post lots of

photos of this little creation. And, feel
free to send me photos, I get a big kick
out of it! I love it!

And, I’ve gotta go, I’m bringing this
to a party.
Alright, thanks you guys, bye-bye!
